definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: The opportunities for gerontological social workers seem extensive.
sentences.chinese: 爲老年社會工作者的機會似乎廣泛。

sentences.english: Another is to become an educator or a social worker.
sentences.chinese: 另一個條出路就是成爲教育工作者或社會工作者。

sentences.english: I believe that we are not real social workers.
sentences.chinese: 我想，我們算不上真正的社會工作者。

sentences.english: The bill require a social worker to seek permission of the juvenile court.
sentences.chinese: 該議案要求社會工作者尋求少年法庭的允許。

sentences.english: I've now understood what a caseworker is doing.
sentences.chinese: 我現在明白了社會工作者是從事什麼工作的了。

sentences.english: That’s one way out. Another is to become an educator or a social worker.
sentences.chinese: 另一個條出路就是成爲教育工作者或社會工作者。

sentences.english: How then, did these social workers pull it off?
sentences.chinese: 後來這些社會工作者是怎麼做到的呢？

sentences.english: Can non-registered social workers join this insurance scheme?
sentences.chinese: 非註冊的社會工作者可否參加這保險計劃？

sentences.english: Or, they tell the caseworker that the landlord raised the rent by a hundred dollars.
sentences.chinese: 或者，他們告訴社會工作者房東提高了一百美元房租。

sentences.english: One belongs to an attorney and the other to a social worker".
sentences.chinese: 它們分別屬於一個律師和一個社會工作者。

pinyin: Xiang1 gang3 Hong2 Shi2 zi4 hui4

definition: student who also works part-time/(old) reform-school student
a tax declaration form/a tax return
organizing committee/abbr. to 組委|组委
to stipulate/to state expressly/to explicitly provide for
